all.kikuyu: You've uploaded several images containing Kikuyu language lessons, covering vocabulary, grammar, and sentence structure. Here is a compilation and synthesis of the information presented in those images. *** ## 1. Grammar: Future Tenses (Second Person Singular) The images illustrate the **Second Person Singular** (you) future tense, which has different prefixes depending on the time frame. ### ⏳ A Few Moments Later or Anytime Today The prefixes used for actions happening soon are **Ûgû-, Ûgwî-, Ûkwî-,** and **Ûkû-**. | Example | Translation | Prefix | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Ûgûkîra** dagîka ikûmi ciathira. | You will wake up after ten minutes. | Ûgû- | | **Ûgwîthamba** na maî mahoro. | You will take a bath with cold water. | Ûgwî- | | **Ûkwîhumba** nguo naihenya. | You will put on your clothes quickly. | Ûkwî- | ### 🗓️ Anytime Tomorrow and Into the Future The prefixes used for actions happening tomorrow or beyond are **Ûgo-, Ûge-, Ûke-,** and **Ûga-**. | Example | Translation | Prefix | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Ûgokîra** dagîka ikûmi ciathira. | You will wake up ten after ten minutes. | Ûgo- | | **Ûgethamba** na maî mahoro. | You will take a bath with cold water. | Ûge- | | **Ûkehumba** nguo naihenya. | You will put on your clothes quickly. | Ûke- | | **Ûkaruga** caî. | You will make tea. | Ûka- | *** ## 2. Vocabulary: Types of Houses (*Mîthemba ya Nyûmba*) The lessons cover three main types of traditional and modern houses, focusing on construction materials. | Type of House | Kikuyu Term | Construction Material | Roofing Material | Other Feature | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Stone House** | **Nyûmba ya Mahiga** | **Mahiga** (stones) | **Mabati** (iron sheets) | **Rûthingo rwa mahiga** (stone wall) | | **Timber House** | **Nyûmba ya mbaû** | **Mbaû** (timber/wood) | **Maturubarĩ** (tiles) | **Rûthingo rwa mbaû** (wooden wall) | | **Mud Hut** | **Nyûmba ya ndooro** | **Ndooro** (mud) | **Nyeki** (grass) or **ithanjĩ** (reeds) | **Rûthingo rwa ndooro** (mud wall) | *** ## 3. Vocabulary: Fauna and Weather ### 🐾 Insects (*Tûnyamû tûnyinyi*) | Kikuyu | English | Notes | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Mûthûa** | Termite | | | **Thûraku** | Soldier ant | Moves in a line. | | **Thigiriri** | Black ant | Small black ants. | | **Mûgagaca** | Fire ant | Very tiny brown ants that move in large groups. | ### 🐦 Birds (*Nyoni*) | Kikuyu | Scientific Name | English Name | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Kanyua njui** | *Cinnyris mediocris* | Sunbird | | **Gĩchorogothu** | *Pycnonotus barbatus* | Common bulbul | | **Ngũgũ** | *Tauraco hartlaubi* | Hartlaub's Turaco | ### ⛈️ Weather and Seasons (*Hîndî ya Mbura na ya riua*) | Kikuyu | English | Notes | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Rûheni** | Lightening | Comes before **marurumĩ** (thunder). | | **Mbura nî ya ringa** | The rain has started | Literally: 'the rain has beaten'. | | **Nî kûrathuthua** | It is drizzling | | | **Ime** | Dew | | | **Matu ma mbura** | Rain clouds | The grey ones. | | **Rûkûngû** | Dust | | | **Kigûû** | Flash flood | This word means *water* in Kikamba. | | **Thano** | Very dry season | | | **Mûkûnga mbura** | Rainbow | | | **Kwîna kibii** | There is fog | | *** ## 4. Grammar: Kikuyu Pronoun Table The image provides an overview of various pronouns and their variations due to noun class. | Category | Singular | Plural | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **I, me, myself** | **Nîî** | **(We, ourself) ithuî** | | **You** | **Wëë** | **Inyuî** | | **He, she** | **Wë** | **(Them) O** | | **mine** | Wakwa, Gĩakwa, gakwa, yakwa, rĩakwa | Ciakwa, Akwa, Makwa, twakwa | | **yours** | Gĩaku, gaku, yaku, waku, rĩaku | Ciaku, Twaku, ma-ku, aku | | **His/hers** | Gĩake, gake, yake, wake, rĩake | Ciake, Twake, make, ake | | **Theirs'** | Kĩao, kao, yao, rĩao, wao | Cĩao, Twao, mao, ao | | **it** | Kĩo, ko, yo, guo, rĩo | Cĩo, yo, mo, o | | **Who?** | **Ûû?** | **A?** | | **Anybody** | **Mûndû o wothe** | **Andû o

all.kikuyu: Extracted Text from Images Here is the text extracted from the images you provided: --- ### Image 1: Kikuyu Creation Story (Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi) **Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi** **Aciari a rũrĩrĩ rwa Gĩkũyũ nĩ a ?** Who are the parents of the kikuyu tribe? **Aciari a rũrĩrĩ rwa Gĩkũyũ nĩ Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi** The parents of the Kikuyu are Gĩkũyũ and Mũũmbi **Maarĩ na ciana cigana?** How many children did they have? **Marĩ na ciana kenda** They had nine children. **Kenda mũiyũrũ** - the full nine (ten) **Tũhĩĩ kana tũirĩtu?** Girls or boys? **Tũirĩtu** - Girls. **Rũrĩrĩ** - a community speaking one language **Nyũmba** - house (traditionally woman's hut) **Thingira** - hut (traditionally for men) **Ikũmbĩ** - granary **Mũgũnda** - garden, farm. **Gĩcagi** - a village --- ### Image 2: Jobs (Wĩra) **Jobs** **(Nĩĩ) Nđĩ bundi** - I am a handyman (carpenter, plumber etc.) **Nđutaga wĩra wa mbaũ** - I work with timber **. (Wee) wĩ mũrĩmi** - You are a farmer **Ũrutaga wĩra wa mũgũnda** - You work in a farm **. (We) nĩ ndereba** - he/she is a driver **. (Inyuĩ) mwĩ atongoria** - You (plural) are leaders **Mũrutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria anđũ** - your job is to lead people **. (O) nĩ borithi** - they are police (men/women) **Marutaga wĩra wa kũũnĩtĩa anđũ** - their work is to arrest people **. Ũyũ nĩ mũũbĩa** - this is a priest (catholic) **Arutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria magongona ma kanitha** - His work is to lead church services 1. **(Nĩĩ) Nđĩ mũhũrĩri wa mbica** - I am a photographer 2. **(Wee) wĩ mũgwĩmi** - You are a hunter 3. **(We) nĩ mũrĩithia wa mahiũ** - he/she is a herder (of domestic animals) 4. **(Inyũĩ) mwĩ aturi** - You are iron mongers 5. **(O) nĩ ombi a nyũngũ** - they are potters (lit. molders of pots) 6. **Ũyũ nĩ mũgo** - This is a medicine (person) **Write sentences in Kikuyu to say what Numbes 1. to 6. do. Use the following verbs - 1. Kũhũra mbica, 2. kũgwĩma, 3. Kũrĩithia, 4. gũtura, 5. kũũmba, 6. kũragũra (Example: arutaga wĩra wa kũragũra)** --- ### Image 3: Polite Term for Snake **Nyamũ ya thĩ** - a polite way of refering to a **snake** (to avoid attracting it to your house). --- ### Image 4: Counting and Birds **Mbata** - Duck **Ngũkũ ya mwera** - Hen **Gacui** - chick **Ngũkũ ya njamba** - Cock --- ### Image 5: Some Verbs **Some Verbs that you should know** **Gũcaria** - to search **Gũcoka** - to return, to come back (person) **Gũcokia** - to return (an object) **Gũĩka** - To do **Gũikara** - to stay **Gũikara thĩ** - to sit down **Gũikena** - To be happy **Gũkinya** - To arrive, to step on **Gũthambia** - to wash **Gũthĩĩ rũgendo** - To go on a journey **Gũthũkia** - To damage, to spoil **Gũtigara** - to remain **Gũtinia** - to cut **Gweterera** - To wait **Gwĩcĩrĩria** - to think, to reason **Kũgeria** - to try --- ### Image 6: Family Terms (Nuclear and Extended) **Nuclear family** **Baba** - father **Maitũ** - Mother **Mũrũ wa maitũ** - Brother **Mwarĩ wa maitũ** - Sister **Mũrũ wa baba** - Half Brother **Mwarĩ wa baba** - Half Sister **Extended family** **Guka** - Grandfather (Muranga/Kiambu Kikuyu) **Wagũi** - Grandfather (Nyeri Kikuyu) **Cũcũ** - Grandmother **Tata** - Aunt **Mama** - Uncle (Mother's side) **Baba mũnini** - Uncle (Father's younger brother) **Baba mũkũrũ** - Uncle (Father's older brother) **Mũrũ wa tata** - Cousin **Mũrũ wa mama** - Cousin **NOTE**: All your Father's brothers' wives are adressed as "**mother**" **Thooma na ũnyite mũgambo** - read and record --- ### Image 7: Conversation about Family **Nuclear Family** **Ũyũ nĩ baba** - this is father **Ũyũ ũngĩ nĩ maitũ** - this other one is mother **Tũrũgamĩte na mwarĩ wa maitũ** - We are standing with my sister **Ũcio mũraihu nĩ mama** - the tall one is my uncle (mother's side) **Baba arahũra mbica** - Father is taking photographs **Mwarimũ:** Maina rũgama Maina, stand up **Maina:** Nĩ nđarũgama Mwarimũ **Mwarimũ:** Ũyũ nũũ ? Who is this **Maina:** Ũyũ nĩ baba **Mwarimũ:** Ũyũ ũngĩ nĩ nũũ ? **Maina:** Ũyũ ũngĩ nĩ maitũ **Mwarimũ:** Mũrũgamĩte naũ? **Maina:** Tũrũgamĩte na Mwarĩ wa maitũ **Mwarimũ:** ĩkara thĩ Sit down --- ### Image 8: Cold Days (Mĩthenya ya heho) **Mĩthenya ya heho - cold days** 1. **Hĩ! all.kikuyu: July) is usually very cold **Vocabulariy** **Kaĩ** - this is a prefix that turns a statement into a question. Adding a syllable '**ĩ**' at the end of the sentence cancels out the question back to an emphatic statement. **Kwĩna heho** - it is cold, **Kaĩ kwĩna heho**? - is it cold? **Kaĩ kwĩna heho - ĩ**? It is really cold **Heho** - cold; **ũrugarĩ** - heat, warmth; **Mwaki** - fire; **Gĩchĩnga** - a stick that is smoldering with fire. **Burana** - cardigan, sweater; **ĩgooti** - coat; **Kabuti** - over coat; **mũrĩngĩti** - blanket; **Ĩkĩra** - put (in this case 'put on - wear'); **Kwĩhũmba** - to wear; **Mweri** - month (moon); **Mũno** - very much --- ### Animals and Parts of

all.kikuyu: Thooma wanĩĩrire** - **read aloud.** --- **Mbata** - **Duck** **Ngũkũ ya mwera** - **Hen** **Gacui** - **chick** **Ngũkũ ya njamba** - **Cock** --- **Nyamũ ya thĩ** - a polite way of refering to a **snake** (to avoid attracting it to your house). --- **Cĩĩga cia nyoni - Parts of a bird** * **eye** - **Ritho / Maitho** * **head** - **Mũtwe / Mĩtwe** * **beak** - **Mũkangi / Mĩkangi** * **neck** - **Ngingo** * **wings** - **ĩthagu / Mathagu** * **feather** - **Ruoya / Njoya** * **body** - **Mwĩrĩ / Mĩrĩ** * **tail feathers** - **Njoya cia Kĩngũĩ** * **leg** - **Kũgũrũ / Magũrũ** --- ### Jobs **Jobs** **(Nĩĩ) Nđĩ bundi** - I am a handyman (carpenter, plumber etc.) **Nđutaga wĩra wa mbaũ** - I work with timber **. (Wee) wĩ mũrĩmi** - You are a farmer **Ũrutaga wĩra wa mũgũnda** - You work in a farm **. (We) nĩ nđereba** - he/she is a driver **. (Inyuĩ) mwĩ atongoria** - You (plural) are leaders **Mũrutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria anđũ** - your job is to lead people **. (O) nĩ borithi** - they are police (men/women) **Marutaga wĩra wa kũũnĩtĩa anđũ** - their work is to arrest people **. Ũyũ nĩ mũũbĩa** - this is a priest (catholic) **Arutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria magongona ma kanitha** - His work is to lead church services 1. **(Nĩĩ) Nđĩ mũhũrĩri wa mbica** - I am a photographer 2. **(Wee) wĩ mũgwĩmi** - You are a hunter 3. **(We) nĩ mũrĩithia wa mahiũ** - he/she is a herder (of domestic animals) 4. **(Inyũĩ) mwĩ aturi** - You are iron mongers 5. **(O) nĩ ombi a nyũngũ** - they are potters (lit. molders of pots) 6. **Ũyũ nĩ mũgo** - This is a medicine (person) **Write sentences in Kikuyu to say what Numbes 1. to 6. do. Kikuyus were traditionally farmers, hence the origin of the phrase.

all.kikuyu: This looks like a great way to start learning **Kikuyu**! Combining the words you have here is a perfect exercise. Here are ten simple sentences formed by combining the verbs and nouns from your image: ## Simple Kikuyu Sentences 🇰🇪 1. **Ũka haha.** $\rightarrow$ Come here. 2. **Andĩka marũa.** $\rightarrow$ Write a letter. 3. **Rĩra maĩ.** $\rightarrow$ Cry for water. (This could also mean "Cry water," depending on context, but "cry for water" is a common simple expression). 4. **Theka mũthũuri.** $\rightarrow$ Laugh at the man. 5. **Rĩa irio.** $\rightarrow$ Eat food. 6. **Aria na mwanake.** $\rightarrow$ Speak with the young man. 7. **Thii wĩra.** $\rightarrow$ Go to work. 8. **Thooma marũa.** $\rightarrow$ Read a letter. 9. **Ruga ũcũrũ.** $\rightarrow$ Cook porridge. 10. **Mũirĩtu aruta wĩra.** $\rightarrow$ The girl is doing work. (Literally: Girl remove/do work). --- ### A Few Bonus Sentences! ✨ Here are a few more using the remaining words for extra practice: * **Kira, mũtumia.** $\rightarrow$ Keep quiet, woman. * **Ruta irio.** $\rightarrow$ Remove the food. * **Mũthũuri arĩa irio.** $\rightarrow$ The man is eating food. Let me know if you'd like to try translating any of those sentences back into English or if you have another list of words you'd like to work

all.kikuyu: Here is the transcription and translation of the Kikuyu story titled "Karũgano ka Wambũi Mĩcore na Njogu" (Story of Zebra and Elephant), presented in plain text: *** ## Transcription and Translation: Story of Zebra and Elephant **Karũgano ka Wambũi Mĩcore na Njogu** - **Translation** **Story of Zebra and Elephant** * **Wambũi Mĩcore** - **Zebra** * **yarĩ ĩmwe ya nyamũ** - **was one of the animals** * **irĩa ciarĩ thaka mũno** - **that were most beautiful** * **bũrũriinĩ wa nyamũ** - **in the country of animals** * **Yarĩ na rũũa rũthaka** - **it had a beautiful hide (skin)** * **rwa mĩkarara mĩerũ na mĩirũ** - **with black and white stripes** * **Nyamũ ciothe** - **all the animals** * **ciamĩroragĩra ĩgegete mũno** - **looked at (Zebra) in awe** * **Nyamũ cionaga** - **the animals saw** * **ĩrĩ ya mathekania mũno** - **as very funny** * **Yatũmaga matheke** - **it made them laugh** * **kinya makoma mbaru** - **until their ribs ached (hardened)** * **Mamĩũragia atĩrĩrĩ** - **They used to ask it...** * **Mĩcore, ũhũraga thũ cĩaku atĩa?** - **Striped one, how do you fight your enemies?** * **Mĩcore yarũgamaga** - **The striped one would stand** * **na magũrũ ma mbere** - **with the forelegs** * **ĩgaikĩia mateke** - **and kicked** * **na magũrũ ma thutha** - **with the rear legs** * **Nyamũ ciothe** - **all the animals** * **cĩagũagĩa na mũtheko** - **fell down laughing (broke into laughter)** * **Hĩtĩ nĩyo yathekaga** - **hyena is the one that laughed** * **na mũgambo mũnene** - **in a loud voice** * **gũkĩra nyamũ irĩa ingĩ** - **than all the other animals** * **O na ũmũthĩ** - **even today** * **hĩtĩ yarĩrikana** - **when hyena remembers** * **ũrĩa Wambũi Mĩcore** - **how the zebra** * **ĩrũaga** - **fights** * **ĩthekaga ĩrĩ ĩkĩ ũtuko** - **it laughs alone in the night** (A faded watermark vertically on the right side

all.kikuyu: Here is the transcription of the text in the image: **Wakerĩ rũũcinĩ** **Tuesday morning** * **Metha** (table) **ĩyo nĩ njega** * That table is good * **Riiko** (cooker) **rĩũ nĩ rĩega** * That cooker is good * **Macani** (tea leaves) **mau nĩ mega** * Those tea leaves are good * **Mboco** (beans) **icio nĩ njega** * Those beans are good * **Gĩkombe** (cup) **kĩu nĩ kĩega** * That cup is good * **Riiko** - **Cooker** * **Riiko** - **Kitchen**
